abstract: Google makes one million books available on a Kindle rival as Amazon files opposition to Google’s settlement with authors and publishers.
snippet: Google makes one million books available on a Kindle rival as Amazon files opposition to Google’s settlement with authors and publishers.
lead_paragraph: Update | Sept. 3, 12:43 p.m.  Correcting information about the Google deal in first paragraph. The deal will put public domain books on the Coolerbooks.com site, not just the Cool-er reader. Thanks to Gary Ling for pointing this out in the comments.

headline.main: Google and Amazon Increasingly at Odds Over E-Books
